issues.title: Missing Specific Parent/Guardian Notification Requirements
issues.description: Education Code 234.7 requires districts to notify parents/guardians of specific rights including: (1) right to free public education regardless of immigration status, (2) information about safe haven laws, and (3) general information about immigration enforcement. While the BP mentions notification generally, neither document specifies the required content about safe haven laws or provides the comprehensive notification framework required by statute.

legal_citations.text: A school district shall provide parents and guardians with information regarding their children's right to a free public education regardless of immigration status or religious beliefs, information about safe haven laws, and general information about immigration enforcement.

issues.required_language: The district shall provide parents/guardians with information regarding: (1) their children's right to a free public education regardless of immigration status or religious beliefs, (2) information about safe haven laws, and (3) general information about immigration enforcement. This notification shall be provided annually and made available in the primary languages spoken by students and parents/guardians in the district.

issues.title: Missing Confidentiality Requirements for Board Reporting
issues.description: While both documents mention reporting to the Board, neither specifies the required confidentiality protections mandated by Education Code 234.7(g) when reporting immigration enforcement encounters to the Board. The statute requires specific language about protecting potentially identifying information.

legal_citations.text: A school district shall report to its governing board, in a manner that ensures the confidentiality and privacy of any potentially identifying information, any requests for information or access to a school site by an officer or employee of a law enforcement agency for the purpose of enforcing the immigration laws.

issues.required_language: Reports to the Board regarding immigration enforcement encounters shall be made in a manner that ensures the confidentiality and privacy of any potentially identifying information of students, families, or staff members.

issues.title: Missing Training Requirements Specification
issues.description: The BP mentions that staff shall receive training on immigration issues, but neither document specifies the scope, frequency, or content requirements for this training as implied by Education Code 234.7's comprehensive framework for staff preparedness.

legal_citations.text: The comprehensive framework requires districts to ensure staff are properly trained to implement all provisions of the immigration enforcement response requirements.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall ensure that teachers, administrators, and other school staff receive regular training regarding: (1) students' and families' rights related to immigration enforcement, (2) procedures for responding to immigration officer requests, (3) confidentiality requirements, and (4) resources available to support affected students and families.

issues.title: Missing Reference to Attorney General Guidelines
issues.description: While the BP mentions consistency with California Attorney General requirements, the AR does not reference or incorporate the specific guidelines issued by the Attorney General's office for school districts regarding immigration enforcement encounters.

legal_citations.text: Districts must develop procedures consistent with guidance from the California Attorney General regarding law enforcement access for immigration enforcement purposes.

issues.required_language: All procedures shall be implemented consistent with guidelines issued by the California Attorney General's office regarding immigration enforcement in schools.
